Abstract: Ivica Racan, ex-Communist with a beard and taste for rock music, is favored to become Croatia's next prime minister after parliamentary elections on Jan 3; says that if he wins, he will move to cut spending on social services by 17 percent, offer more cooperation to tribunal in Hague investigating war crimes in former Yugoslavia and not interfere in Bosnia the way Croatia did under late Pres Franjo Tudjman; photo (M)
Snippet: Ivica Racan, ex-Communist with a beard and taste for rock music, is favored to become Croatia's next prime minister after parliamentary elections on Jan 3; says that if he wins, he will move to cut spending on social services by 17 percent, offer ...
LeadParagraph: Ivica Racan, a 55-year-old ex-Communist with a beard and a taste for rock music, is likely to be Croatia's next prime minister if the polls hold and an opposition coalition wins parliamentary elections on Jan. 3.

Headline.Main: Opposition Ex-Communist Favored in Croatia Vote
Headline.PrintHeadline: Opposition Ex-Communist Favored in Croatia Vote
